question: YABBA DABBA DO -- ! Fred happily discards his hard hat, leaps out of the canvas-roofed cab on the dino's back, slides down the tail and bounces right into the seat of his stone and timber car! He gets up to a running start with the only motor , slows to allow a "time clock" dinosaur to punch his stone timecard, and then he's trotting back up to speed and out of the gate! MUSIC comes UP and
answer: I hate this job... There's not even a health plan... Good morning, Bedrock. This is station B-R-O-K with the morning weather and news... It will be fair and mild through the weekend, continuing for the next eight hundred years, followed by cooling breezes and a protracted ice age... Those walking fingers have reached the top edge of the covers... now they pull them down revealing the owner's face... the face of Fred, his eyes at half-mast, his face covered in fashionable "Bedrock Vice" stubble.

question: Wil-ma. Wil-ma? How about a great big good morning kiss for your Freddy-weddy? And he pulls the covers down to reveal -- DINO, who is immediately "YI-YI-YI-YI-ING," hopping all over the bed and showering Fred with sloppy kisses. Dino! Dino, cut it out -- !
answer: In the news, Bedrock civic and business leaders met yesterday to discuss the growing kibble crisis. Ecological activist Ralph Naderock warned that if new supplies of kibble are not found, our animal- powered civilization itself may be threatened.

question: Dino, that's enough -- here, look, Daddy has a nice dino bone for you, just please stop it --
answer: In other news, Bedrock police report that the Xenosaurus has struck again! Yes, the fiercesome intruder was sighted in the Bedrock Hills for the third time this month. Outlying shops and residencies report extensive looting and property destruction...

question: Fred, stop playing with Dino and sit down. Your breakfast's getting cold.
answer: Oooh, Dino, look -- there's a nice big dino bone laying out on the front lawn -- ! -- Gosh, look at that adorable little female dino -- -- That animal's gonna kill me with kindness. Do you know we're out of dino treats?

question: So is everybody else in Bedrock. That kibble crisis is getting worse every day. She puts two giant slices of bread into a toaster. Two claw-like devices hold the toast, pulling it out of sight. I'm afraid Dino's going to have to manage on leftovers from Pebbles and me.
answer: And what's wrong with my leftovers?

question: 'Bye, little sweetheart. 'Bye, big sweetheart.
answer: Nice morning, huh, Fred?

question: What's nice about it?
answer: Heh, hey. That Arnold's got a real arm on him, don't he?

question: This is the third ragtop this year ... say, shouldn't you be at work?
answer: Ah, well, that appliance store and me, we kinda had a little adjustment --

question: You got fired, didn't ya?
answer: Fred, don't start on me again. I donno, I'm just not a nine to five guy. I got dreams, Fred. Ideas --

question: Yeah, I know, I know, those crazy inventions of yours. Be honest with me, Barn... tell me one thing you invented that really caught on.
answer: I invented fire.

question: You invented fire?
answer: I told you that, Fred. But the coal conglomerate ripped me off. The case is still in court, but meanwhile I got lotsa other ideas --

question: Yeah, but did any one of them ever put bread on the table? How long are you and Betty gonna live on those penny-ante royalties you get? If you ask me, pal, you're just blowing smoke up your own volcano...
answer: Maybe, Fred. But first... Let me try some of that smoke on your car. -- See, the first step, we make a mold of the old car hood, smooth out the dent in the clay -- He tosses the original car hood aside with a crash. Then, moving rapidly, he starts heaving a variety of ingredients into the reverse imprint of the car hood. -- Add some lava granules... some woca leaves... juice from two coo-coo berries...

question: Two coo-coo berries? You made of money, Barney?
answer: Anything for a pal, Fred -- a lump of coal... bamboo sawdust... eucalyptus sap... a touch of the La Brea tarbrush -- and -- voila. Barney dips a finger in this mess, "tastes" it; satisfied, he yanks on a hanging rope and a giant rock weight slams down on the whole mess, making Fred jump out of his skin.

question: Not bad, eh? After it cures for an hour or so, it's solid as a rock.
answer: Okay, you fixed a dented hood. But you call that a living? Face it, pal, this is the Stone Age, and it's a dino eat dino world. You want my advice?

question: Did I ever?
answer: You stick with me today, cruise on down to the quarry and fill out a job application. I'm a big man there, Barney --

question: You're a big man anywhere, Fred --
answer: I'm serious, pal. Me and Mr. Slate are just like this -- He takes his hand off the wheel to hold up two fingers... ends up swerving instead. -- just like that. I know, I know -- you're not a clock-punching guy -- but face it, Barney -- it's time to grow up and put your nose to the grindstone, batten down the hatches and join the ratasaurus race with the rest of us. It's time to retire those dreams. Barney looks glum, doesn't say anything. Suddenly Fred pulls over, stops the car. Barney. Look.

question: Hey. Lava Lane.
answer: Remember the old days, Barn? We used to race our go-carts here to impress the girls.

question: Yeah, those were the days... we usta dream about coming back here some day with a real car and goin' for the goldrock...! Fred... I thought you said it was time to retire those old dreams.
answer: Hey. Since when do I have to be consistent?

question: Well, Flintstone, looks like today's the day.
answer: Sergeant Feldspar, I... I wasn't speeding... honest...

question: Forget it, Flintstone. This time I got you dead to rights -- Fred opens the box. A scary-looking winged reptile sticks out its head, smacks its hungry lips. Gravel. Get me the radar reading and I'll show you how we deal with scofflaws.
answer: Well, Sergeant, if you don't have a radar reading, I guess we'll -- -- justbeonourway -- !

question: 'Fred...'? David! Herman! Get Rob and BoBo and tell 'em to bring the big dolly! You got it. Now then... Mrs. Slate? You're in a no parking zone there.
answer: Well, if I get some service, I'll be out of it, won't I? Mrs. Slate steps to the counter. Meanwhile, the staff begin using a refrigerator dolly to bring out giant ribs, steaks and sausages which they pile up in front of Wilma. I want a nice fresh, juicy chickensaurus, Morris. And not one you've had laying around on the shelf. I mean fresh.

question: Mrs. Slate, we're kind of busy now --
answer: I don't care if you're busy. What I care about is my adorable little grand nephew. He's staying with me for the summer and I intend to make his favorite dish... Southern fried chickensaurus! Now I want a fresh chickensaurus and I want it now!

question: Boys, you heard her... she said fresh.
answer: Morris, while you're at it, I'd like it plucked -- My car -- !

question: Yer on, Pyrite -- Pyrite tosses a walnut, which bounces on the ledge. The wrecking BALL SMASHES into the stone wall.
answer: Not again... Fred hustles up a ladder to a ramp which leads him up to the level of Piltdown's cab. Barney hurries to follow. All right, Piltdown, that's enough! You're endangering your fellow workers!

question: Yeah? Sez who?
answer: Says me, Fred Flintstone -- shop steward of Amalgamated Neolithic Workers 101.

question: Yeah? Well, A.N.W. one-oh-one gives us workers a snack break. So... ... I'm breakin' some snacks.
answer: Whoa, whoa, big fella -- He calms the beast by giving it a carrot. As it munches, Fred quickly ties the reins to a post. You're on report, Piltdown! If it's up to me you'll be pushing a wheelbarrow!

question: You've been asking for this, Flintstone... I'm gonna kick your fat butt --
answer: Fat butt? Hold me back, Barney -- -- Barney, hold me back -- Quickly the men form a circle around Piltdown and Fred. Barney looks up and sees --

question: It's not like the boys to be so late.
answer: Unless they were forced to go bowling again. Remember that time a burglar pointed a gun at them and said, 'go bowling right now'?

question: Betty, sometimes you're a little too gullible --
answer: Don't tell me. I still can't believe what I did today...

question: No kidding. Do you have any idea of what the enrollment fee is? And get this... it's non-refundable --
answer: I know, I know! I just couldn't stand that woman's attitude! But we had to find a new school anyway, and there we were... the next thing I knew, I was in over my head... but why did you jump in, too?

question: Oh, she was getting to me too with all that mastodon snort about her little nephew... and...
answer: And?

question: And... if a friend can't help you do something stupid, who can?
answer: What do we tell the boys?

question: What's wrong with the truth?
answer: We put ourselves in debt so the kids can attend school with a family we can't stand?

question: Maybe we could rephrase it... Suddenly the door bursts open. Fred and Barney run in with candy and flowers.
answer: Flowers?

question: My apologies, Brother Piltdown. Allow me to rephrase. Tonight we will hear speeches from a whole bunch of good old guys... ... plus the one and only Fred Flintstone! Cheers go up, which drown out Piltdown's renewed cry of the poisoned water hole. Fred moves towards the podium as the noise dies down.
answer: Brother Buffaloes, honored Herdmaster, Junior Bucks and Apprentice Antlers, a great good evening to you all. Ahem. As you know, our organization has survived difficult times that have seen the extinction of such other lodges as the Order of Whooping Cranes and Brotherhood of Giant Sloths. But we here have come through the croo ... the crux...

question: -- crucible --
answer: -- crucible with our fur fluffy and our hooves unscathed. Now, the future holds many promises and many problems. As your next Herdmaster, I would bring to you the same determination, courage and -- if I may say so -- bold thinking that I have brought to the workplace. Thank you, and ack ack a-dack. Applause follows Fred's return to the floor. Hey, when you're hot you're hot... boys, lemme buy a round of drinks for everyone.

question: Thanks, Fred, but here at the lodge drinks are free.
answer: But the principle is the same, Barn. Don't forget that. Fred leads the group over to the bar. Piltdown and Pyrite come along with a shrug... why not, for a brew? Fred reaches -- Here you go, boys, nice and frosty... "BOTTLE OPENER" CREATURE Go ahead, laugh. If I had a good orthodontist, my life woulda been different... Fred tosses the "Opener" aside -- Well, here's to... Here's to the greatest bunch of lifelong Buffaloes a guy could dream of leading. Anybody else got a toast...?

question: 'Here's to the Water Buffalo and their next Herdmaster... Fred'!
answer: Aw, gee, Barn... you shouldn't say that... ... at least not till after next week's election! Well, Harry, it just so happens that old Fred is moving up in the world... Boys, you're looking at Mr. Slate's new partner.

question: Aw, gee, Barn... you shouldn't say that... ... at least not till after next week's election! Well, Harry, it just so happens that old Fred is moving up in the world... Boys, you're looking at Mr. Slate's new partner.
answer: You and Slate? Who are you kidding, Flintstone? The only partner you got is hanging over your belt. Pyrite laughs, a bit too much.

question: Prepare to eat those words, Piltdown.
answer: -- If I don't, you will --

question: Gee, Fred, how come I didn't get any business cards?
answer: Barney, it's all part of the plan. Yes, boys, you see, I went up to my pal, Mister Slate and single- handedly made him an offer he couldn't refuse -- -- 'Freddy boy,' he sez to me, 'We gotta talk turkey -- '

question: Fred, we gotta talk turkey --
answer: That's right -- just like that --

question: Fred -- !
answer: Ah, excuse us, boys...

question: Fred... what's this single-handed stuff? I distinctly remember at least four hands and two of them were mine.
answer: Barney, we could tell everyone how you invented this Fibrerock stuff, how Slate and Lava found out about it by accident and all, but what would that be?

question: The truth?
answer: This is big business, Barney. We can't start telling the truth, it'd create the wrong impression. Think about all the really big deals in history -- back to the beginning of recorded time. Barney knits his brow in thought for maybe three seconds.

question: Okay.
answer: What do they all have in common? I'll tell you. A front man. A guy who's out in the public eye running the point, fighting the crowds... and meanwhile... back in the corner is the silent partner.

question: I never knew that.
answer: That's because the silent partner is always silent. But while you're busy being silent -- -- all along you're the brains behind the operation and I'm the brains in front of the operation. I'm out here running the guts of the operation but you got a cut. It looks like my mind, but you're really behind.

question: I get it. I got the brains, but you just pretend to have them.
answer: Attaboy! And a confident Fred shakes hands with an unsure "silent partner"... CUT TO:

question: Fred! Wait a minute! There's something wrong with your lunch --
answer: Yeah... it does feel a little light... He returns to her, opens the pail, is surprised to find it's empty. Before he can comment, she smilingly presents him with a spanking new briefcase. "F.F" is embossed on it in gold.

question: Fit for a king... my king.
answer: Aw, Wilma... lookit, it's got buckles, a strap, a lock -- He opens it. Inside is a huge drumstick and some ribs. -- Baby, you're the greatest.

question: Good luck. Watch out for those... you know... hostile takeovers.
answer: I'm already taken. He moves to the car. Ah, Mister Rubble, I presume? Of the Fibrerock Rubbles?

question: Ivan, look, okay, so I bought too much on margin... everyone said glaciers were here to stay, I mean, who knew? Just leverage my shares in Atlantis dry goods and -- what? When did that happen? Piltdown enters, knocks on the open door.
answer: Mister Lava, the armored car is here.

question: Armored car...?
answer: Yeah. Must be a fortune in coo-coo berries on that baby. You know, for that Fibrerock stuff of Flintstone and Rubble's. You gotta sign here for it.

question: I... I'll get back to you. Piltdown, this Fibrerock program is going to create a lot of changes around the plant. I want to make one more. You've been a wonderful thug and goon for me. Now, I'd like to expand your duties. I want you to become a provocateur.
answer: Gee, Mister Lava, I donno. I kinda like girls myself.

question: What I mean, is, I'm going to use you to double-cross your Lodge and Union brothers, and make their lives a living hell.
answer: Oh, okay.

question: Flintstone!
answer: Mr. Slate -- we gotta talk --

question: We do, eh? About what?
answer: About those guys outside, Mr. Slate. Some of 'em, well, they been here for years. And you, well, you can't lay them off just like -- -- that!

question: Of course I can, Fred. I can lay them off like -- -- that, or like -- -- that, or like -- -- that.
answer: Oh, you can, huh?

question: That's right. Why -- I could lock the front door and go fishing if I wanted! Why, I could even fire Lava here if I wanted. Lava quivers with mock surprise. Everyone really laughs, now. Or... I could fire you, Fred.
answer: Me! Ah, ha, that's rich, Mr. Slate, that's -- Suddenly Fred stops laughing.

question: Flintstone, Lava, here, recommended that you be in charge of public relations to get Fibrerock off to a good start. I'm a member of that public, Flintstone, and I have to say... this isn't a good start. I'm getting a bad feeling about Fibrerock. A bad feeling about... you. You want that feeling to go away, don't you?
answer: Uh... well, gee, I... uh, yeah.

question: Good. Then turn around and walk out of here and we'll forget all about this.
answer: Akkk... something... noble... man ... job... nose... wheel... shoulder... grindstone... hommm... yggggg...

question: Fred! Fred! The Buffalo are heading for big trouble -- !
answer: No kidding. They rejected the best candidate --

question: No, no, not that! Piltdown's got the guys all worked up and they're heading down to the quarry! They're gonna wreck the assembly line!
answer: Oh, no! That -- that's horrible! We could end up with half a percent of nothing!

question: No, Fred, if they do that they'll be breakin' the law! Our brother Buffalo could go to jail!
answer: Oh, yeah, yeah, that, too... come on, Barn, we gotta stop 'em! CUT TO:

question: Excuse me, Mister Lava -- ? I think you oughta know... something could be wrong with the Fibrerock mix.
answer: How do you know that? I mean... ah, why do you say that?

question: It tastes different.
answer: Tastes... different?

question: Yup. See, ever since I started with Fibrerock -- I mean, since me and Fred started with it, I always take a little taste of the Fibre foam. And tonight's batch, well... I didn't get much of it, but it seems a little off. Can't fool the old taste buds, heh-heh. I think there might be an ingredient missing. So tomorrow, I'll run a couple of tests and stuff --
answer: Rubble, Rubble! We're fighting a deadline to finish Slate City... and we're not pulling the plug on production to satisfy your tastebuds! If you ask me, you and your tastebuds are overworked ... overwrought... how long have you been with us, anyway?

question: Nine days, Mister Lava.
answer: Jumping Jurrasic, no wonder you're so run down. I'm authorizing a nice vacation for you, Rubble. Starting tomorrow. You can catch some rays, maybe invent something... hey, how about Fibrerock, the sequel, part II -- ?

question: But --
answer: No, don't try and thank me. ... As you can see, the Fibrerock is so light we're using it for construction, for furnishings... for everything. You can't stack a two-bedroom cave this high... but the sky's the limit with Fibrerock!

question: No, don't try and thank me. ... As you can see, the Fibrerock is so light we're using it for construction, for furnishings... for everything. You can't stack a two-bedroom cave this high... but the sky's the limit with Fibrerock!
answer: 'Sky's the limit'... 'sky's the limit'... why, these two buildings, they... they practically scrape the sky! We should call them... Slate scrapers!

question: That's brilliant, Unc... Mister Slate. In fact, maybe you can help me with the centerpiece of the complex... ... I wanna call 'em the FibreSphere and the '____' something Needle... but I just can't...
answer: How about, 'Slate Needle'?

question: 'Slate Need...' ... How do you keep coming up with these? It's uncanny.
answer: It's a gift...

question: That takes care of the half-pint. Now to deal with the half-wit. CUT TO:
answer: ... But Barney doesn't want to take a vacation -- he says he's gotta be here to check up on the Fibrefoam --

question: -- Oh? Or check up on us? Emotionally, Lava turns, indicates a picture of Slate on the wall. Flintstone, that... that's a slap in the face of our founder... our employer... our uncle. Unless, of course, you agree with Rubble... that Mister Slate isn't capable of running this operation ... that I'm not capable of running it?
answer: Of course not, Mister Lava. But --

question: Call me Jerry. Sit down, please... Fred complies. Lava winces as his designer FURNITURE CREAKS under Fred's weight, but he only says -- ... Cigar?
answer: Why, yeah, sure, Jerry.

question: Fred, let me get to the bottom slime. Some men -- you and me, for instance -- we're cut out for the big time, the big bucks... ... the big everything. Lava smiles, prepares the tips on two cigars. He puts each one in turn in a gizmo on his desk. And others? Wellll... ... Now, I know your pal Barney had a small part in the preliminary research and development of Fibrerock...
answer: Well, actually, I wouldn't say small part... I'd say...

question: Yes?
answer: ... Kind of a medium-sized... well, almost medium-sized... well, really a semi-partial assistant counsulting type, of --

question: You're too kind, Flintstone, that's what I like about you. But you're a big guy with a big decision to make. Are you gonna keep covering for Barney, keep pulling his acornsauruses out of the fire... or are you going to concentrate on your own important duties?
answer: Well, gee, that's tough one -- -- Uh, what are my important duties?

question: Publicity, Flintstone, publicity! And that's why I've got a little surprise for you... for the man who made Fibrerock a household word, I want you to meet the man who's going to make you a household word...
answer: R-rockin' Leach? Indeed, it is he, and he smiles, extends his hands.

question: Barney who?
answer: Hmm. Lovely little guest 'ouse, Mister Flintstone. So simple, so ordinary, so unexceptional... why, h'it's almost quaint. Let's say we start with the camera 'ere, except...

question: W-what's wrong?
answer: Well, just look at that yard over there... barbecues and trikes, not exactly the right image...

question: Maybe you could move those plants to block them out...?
answer: Good idea. Rodney, get 'hoppin' with those greens. The aide nods, gathers some workers. They start moving the potted plants. Puzzled, Wilma comes over.

question: Hello, hello. Bon soir. Good to see ya... glad you could make it... Fred -- there's the bar, make yourself at home -- mi casa es votre casa, so, when in Rome and all that --
answer: Fred, can I talk to you -- ? Fred? Fred? We have a serious problem with Betty and Barney.

question: You mean you can see their house -- ?
answer: I mean you're treating them horribly! What's come over you, Fred? Does a little money mean so much to you that you just turn your back on the things that really count?

question: Wilma, I'm shocked. I wouldn't do that. Okay, I admit it ... But deep down inside, I'm still the same lovable guy you married -- -- Frederick von Flintstone the third --
answer: Arrrgh -- !

question: ... Yas, yas, it's a challenging commodity market these days. Personally, I'm considering petrified forests, but they do say that volcano futures are ready to explode, ha, ha... ... Hey, whoa, what's happening -- Fred! He stumbles through the thinning crowd, clutching at elbows. Hey, what's the hurry? We got a cake shaped like a piece of Fibrerock... I got it, how about some charades? No, even better, twenty questions
answer: Fred... I... I'm sorry it's not working out... Fred turns, puts on a big smile.

question: Whaddya mean, not working out? They're goin' party hopping, that's all. That's what ya do in society, Wilma... you cruise around. They'll go over to Slate's shindig for a while, then they'll come back here.
answer: Fred...

question: You go on over to Slate City, okay?
answer: Fred, I want to be here with you --

question: Nah, me and some of the guys from the country club, we're gonna play poker, yeah, big stakes poker until everybody comes back. Go on with the others. The kids got their show to put on anyway... and I wouldn't want people to think... to think the Flintstones were party poopers.
answer: Come on, Pebbles. We're going to another party.

question: Just you and me now, Dino. Yeah. That's okay. Man and man's best friend. B... Barney?
answer: Hiya, Fred. Boy, the rental place is gonna be mad... ... You feeling better, pal?

question: 'Pal'? How can you call me that? Barney, I... I've been such a... such a... such a...
answer: Creep?

question: Well, yeah. But more of a --
answer: Fool?

question: Well --
answer: Slimeball? Louse? Jackass? Stuck-up blimpasaurus?

question: Barney... can... can you ever forgive me for being such a jerk?
answer: Sure, Fred. I've had lots of practice.

question: Aw, Barn... And he grabs Barney in a big bear hug. Tears in both their eyes, they slap each other on the back, two prehistoric sensitive guys. CUT TO: Boy, those were the days, Barney. Bedrock High winning all those games... and you and me right in the middle of it.
answer: Yeah. Too bad we never made the team.

question: So what? We made the team spirit. That's just as important... whatever happened to those cheerleader costumes?
answer: You know Betty. She never throws anything away. He hauls out an old footlocker, opens it. There they are.

question: Boy. Talk about memories. Fred tosses the cheerleader sweater to Barney, who grins, pulls it on. Fred also starts to get into his old "uniform," but has to suck his gut in mightily. Finally, he can zip it up, stern to stem. Back then, we thought a pop quiz was a big problem. We didn't know how good we had it. No problems, no worries...
answer: Speaking of problems and worries, shouldn't we get on over to Slate's party? Fred has finally "clinked" the monster head down into place. Now, when he talks, the monster's mouth moves in sync.

question: What for? So him and all his fancy friends can look down their noses at us? All they've been doing is using us, Barney. And meanwhile -- -- Meanwhile all the time they were laughing at us.
answer: Yeah? When did you notice that?

question: About an hour ago.
answer: Boy, there's no fooling you, Fred. Suddenly, with a GROWING CREAKING, CRACKING and TINKLING, a scale model of Slate City in the corner begins to fall apart.

question: Wha... what's happening?
answer: I... I don't know... the Fibrerock it's... it's decomposing... but this shouldn't happen...

question: Your old models are just fine...
answer: It should be. There's enough coo-coo berry resin in there to petrify a brontosaurus -- Suddenly Barney gets it. He looks from the older models to the now decomposing little Fibresphere with growing awareness. -- The coo-coo berries! Fred, that's it!

question: What's it?
answer: Remember I said the Fibrefoam tasted funny? It was the coo-coo sap that was missing!

question: But.. why would --
answer: Why? Because coo-coo berries are as valuable as goldrock! And we've had tons of 'em delivered to the plant since we started... somebody musta got greedy --

question: -- Not 'somebody' -- Lava!
answer: Fred, that sap acts as a fixative -- it's the glue that holds the whole formula together -- !

question: Then... what's happening here...
answer: ... Is gonna happen for real in the real Slate City!

question: Oh no... Barney! Wilma and Betty -- and the kids -- they're all there -- With a final WHIMPER, the little FIBRESPHERE CAVES IN and then the nearby SLATE NEEDLE CRUMBLES, model story by model story. Finally the "DISK" on top of the needle is all that's left, wobbling around like a spun dinner plate. It finally falls... EXPLODES. -- B-barney... what do we do?
answer: Coo-coo berry sap, Fred! It's our only chance -- their only chance! Barney gives it a quick test squirt. Fred nods, and they rush out of the room. CAMERA PUSHES IN ON the ruins of the model "Slate City"... CUT TO:

question: Ho, gweat! Hoo bwoke hit, Bahnee! Hi khnat twalk hennymore! Suddenly both men react to an approaching SIREN. They both look back at -- Ho noh! Ahhrisser Felghspah! Haybee whee hould shtop -- ?
answer: What, and explain what you're doing in that costume? Start talking about coo-coo berries and Fibrerock? By then it'll be too late!

question: 'Hen yore height, yore height... Fred pours on more speed. They careen around a turn. CAMERA WHIP PANS TO a road sign
answer: We'd better split up; that way at least one of us can make it to the Slate Needle -- !

question: Sure, pal. We just gotta wait for the fire department. Right, Fred?
answer: Y-yeah. Everything's gonna be just -- Whoa, hoo-hah, aggh -- -- Wait a minute -- I don't feel anything at all --

question: It must be the suit, Fred -- old Bedrock High built them things to last -- Fred looks over at the wall of flame separating the guests from the fire hose. As everyone gets the same idea, Dino rushes up, the costume head in his mouth. All brighten. -- Okay?
answer: Hist hust fine! He lowers his head, runs through the fire, which licks at him harmlessly. Then with his claw, he SMASHES the amber GLASS -- Hit fuzz nudding... wheely... The pythonsaurus looks around at the attention.

question: Flintstone. Rubble. I... I don't know what to say. I... I treated you horribly... I ignored you, abused you... and then you come here and risk your necks like this... well, there's no price you can put on something like that, so I won't even try. But let me give you... ... a hearty handshake.
answer: Dear, don't you think a little more than that is in order?

question: Honey, you're being hysterical, go lie down, okay?
answer: I am not being hysterical, I am being fair -- now the Flintsteins and Rabbles saved all of our lives, not to mention your reputation.
